hints.content:
We can think of subtraction as:

$\goldE{\text{ part}} = \maroonD{\text{total}} - \blueE{\text{part}} $

We can also think of subtraction as:

$\blueE{\text{part}} = \maroonD{\text{total}} - \goldE{\text{ part}}$

So, we can subtract $\goldE{41}$ from $\maroonD{79}$ to find the missing $\blueE{\text{part}}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/24ab0079f2d9db68a2b4616645f7fd17a2503de4)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?**  
*Hint: Use the place value blocks to help solve.*

$41 = 79 - {}$ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]   

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/b86103ea3bd4c9e695f6043fda5e942358561249)
